title: Kriwat-Other Holocaust-Persecution of Germans 1944-1949(2004)

For english-only speaking:
This book is in german language. English title would be: The Other Holocaust - Persecution of Germans 1944-1949 (2004). Karsten Kriwat's shocking book exposes for the first time never before published eyewitness reports of unbelievable ethnic cleansing that was perpetrated by the allied forces upon the German population. It is properly named as the "other holocaust" since you probably never heard of it although it murdered millions in the most brutal way imagined. In contrast to the crimes of nazis against humanity, these have yet to be uncovered, properly documented and presented to the public mind. Germans were forced to pay war reparation costs in billions, yet they themselves received none. The author documents the crimes of these "liberators" in this groundbreaking work that follows the deadly agenda from Versailles to Jalta and Potsdam and the massacres that followed. Among events covered is the massacre in Nemmersdorf, sinking of refugee ships "Wilhelm Gustloff", "Steuben" and "Goya" that took thousands of women and children to the bottom of the sea. Even the forced trip of Eastgermans to forced labor to Soviet Union is covered and for the first time exposed is the systematic separation of German children from their mothers in Polish concentration camps. This amazing book also sheds light to the integration of persecuted Germans after 1945 with the rest of the country and the events that continue to this very day. You are about to read one of the forbidden chapters of world history. 160 pages.
